column5: as the title says im looking for places like dams in perry sound to shoore fish for walleyes. We have froends that moved up there and we want to go visit them. I hoping to do some shore fishing and would love some info..Can any other OFNers help out? Thanks a ton guys! Oh and if you dont want to post spots on here please feel free to PM me. you would be doing me a huge favor..

I had a buddy go there on Monday. He went to Parry Island (over the bridge) and fished for rainbows beside the hatchery. It costs $10 for a special licence there and kids under 12 are free. 2 Bows is the limit and you can drive right up to the retaining wall and fish from your vehicle or off the wall. He didn't have any luck but he witnessed two big ones including a 10 pounder get caught. The only advice he gave me was bring a long handle or stick to attach to your landing net because the water is 10 feet below the wall. He was using roe bags but the guy who caught the 2 bows was using the power bait play-dough stuff. Bobber with about 8' of line below. My buddy saw 3-4 surface so a spinner may work as well.  No advice for eyes sorry.
The Parry Sound area is large right in the sound or outside?
Well they are in the sound, so in town would be best. however we would be into a bit of a small road trip.
Go to the Scuba/bait shop on Bowes St. they  should send you in the right direction.
Ill have my friend go there in the next few days. Thanks. Is there any dams or locks in the area the waleyes will come into at night?
Mill Lake right off HWY 69. There is a dam there and we use to catch walleye all the time, jighead and a minnow.   Peps
sorry forgot to add......it is right before parry sound on the west side of the highway
Awesome Peps your the man! Just made the trip to PS that much better!!!
let us know how you make out
i'm heading up there this weekend as well.  wasnt going to bring the rods but now they're getting packed.  ryan
